       <header class="entry-header">
        <h1 class="entry-title" itemprop="headline">
         Should I buy a PS4 or Xbox One?
        </h1>
        <p class="entry-meta">
         <time class="entry-time" datetime="2014-11-20T08:00:26+00:00" itemprop="datePublished">
          November 20, 2014
         </time>
         By
         <span class="entry-author" itemprop="author" itemscope="itemscope" itemtype="http://schema.org/Person">
          <a class="entry-author-link" href="http://whatisplaystation4.com/author/miguel/" itemprop="url" rel="author">
           <span class="entry-author-name" itemprop="name">
            Miguel Vidaure
           </span>
          </a>
         </span>
         <span class="entry-comments-link">
          <a href="http://whatisplaystation4.com/should-i-buy-a-ps4-or-xbox-one/#respond">
           <span class="dsq-postid" data-dsqidentifier="4193 http://whatisplaystation4.com/?p=4193">
            Leave a Comment
           </span>
          </a>
         </span>
        </p>
       </header>
       <div class="entry-content" itemprop="text">

         function essb_window2002709685(oUrl, oService) {  essb_window(oUrl, oService, 4193);  }; function essb_pinterenst2002709685() { essb_pinterenst(); }

        <div style="float: right; padding: 5px;">
         <!-- START YieldSelect.com Private Marketplace Tag For WhatIsPlayStation4.com -->
         <!-- Size: 300x250 -->
         <script src="http://ads-by.yieldselect.com/tags/8122/1436/async/300x250.js" type="text/javascript">
         </script>
         <!-- YieldSelect.com Private Marketplace Tag For WhatIsPlayStation4.com -->
        </div>
        <p>
         If theres one thing that has helped the gaming industry grow and evolve to give us the
         <a href="http://whatisplaystation4.com/top-10-ways-to-get-the-best-ps4-experience/">
          amazing experiences we can enjoy today
         </a>
         , its competition.
        </p>
        <p>
         For those of you that enjoy watching sports, just think how boring it would be if there werent any rivalries to spice things up. Alabama vs. Auburn, Red Sox vs. Yankees, Real Madrid vs. Barcelona all matchups that never fail to bring an intensity and desire to not just defeat the opponent but completely crush them.
        </p>
        <p>
         Like any market where the goal is convincing consumers to buy your product and not your competitors, video games is no exception. Who can forget Segas infamous Genesis does what Nintendont commercials?
        </p>
        <h2>
         Competition is a good thing
        </h2>
        <p>
         <a href="http://whatisplaystation4.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/PS4-versus-Xbox-One-comparison-e1426891519669.jpg">
          <img alt="Buy a PS4 or Xbox One" class="alignnone wp-image-4246 size-large" height="494" src="http://whatisplaystation4.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/PS4-versus-Xbox-One-comparison-e1426891519669-1024x494.jpg" width="1024"/>
         </a>
        </p>
        <p>
         After
         <a href="http://whatisplaystation4.com/the-entire-history-of-playstation-vs-xbox/">
          going at it for two console generations
         </a>
         , Sony and Microsoft prepared for the next round by making E3 2013 all about crushing each other.
        </p>
        <p>
         Sure the negative bashing on social media and video game website comment pages gets annoying. But its the spirit of competition that promotes creativity in the industry and keeps the big companies on their toes. One could argue that competition has even motivated companies to listen to what consumers have to say instead of their investors, which is usually a good thing.
        </p>
        <p>
         And its because of competition that both the PlayStation 4 and Xbox One are worth having. Of course, you may fall into the group of people that simply cant afford both machines or only wants one console for now.
        </p>
        <p>
         It then comes down to one question:
         <em>
          Should I buy a PS4 or Xbox One?
         </em>
        </p>
        <p>
         We hope to make that decision a little easier for you by talking about the benefits that each console brings.
        </p>
        <p>
         You can also check out the PS4 vs. Xbox One comparison section to see how both consoles fair when it comes to some of the more popular functions, features, and issues. This way youll have a better idea of which console is right for you without us blatantly telling you which to buy.
        </p>
        <p>
         *Hint: Get both if you can!
        </p>
        <h2>
         Benefits and features of the PS4
        </h2>
        <h3>
         <span style="color: #000000;">
          Graphics/Specs
         </span>
        </h3>
        <a class="easyazon-link" data-cart="n" data-cloak="y" data-identifier="B00EW6QT76" data-locale="US" data-localize="y" data-popups="y" data-tag="whaispla400-20" href="http://whatisplaystation4.com/product/B00EW6QT76/US/whaispla400-20/" rel="nofollow" target="_blank">
         <img class="easyazon-image alignnone" height="334" src="http://whatisplaystation4.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/41dn1krPyAL.jpg" width="500"/>
        </a>
        <p>
         The PlayStation 4 features an AMD Jaguar 8 core CPU, allowing the next-gen console to complete more complex processes at one time than any system before it. This means that you can finally hop out of a game to view a game video on the PS4s browser without having to close either at any point.
        </p>
        <p>
         You can also expect breathtaking visuals thanks to the AMD next-generation Radeon-based graphics engine. With such an advanced GPU the PS4 can provide graphics like never before, including realistic visual effects, detailed character models, complex environments, and more.
        </p>
        <p>
         Of course, who cares about being able to produce jaw-dropping visuals if the console cant load such tremendous amounts of information fast enough? Fortunately the PS4 comes with 8GB of GDDR5 RAM, which is enough to make sure the GPU can handle maintaining crisp textures and graphics when things get busy on screen.
        </p>
        <p>
         Lastly, the PS4s specs allow it to produce 3D visuals. If you have a 3D television or monitor and want to watch 3D-Blu Ray movies or shows, youll be able to enjoy this immersive feature with no problem.
        </p>
        <p>
         For a more in-depth look at the
         <a href="http://whatisplaystation4.com/playstation-4-specs-and-capabilities/">
          PlayStation 4s specs and capabilities
         </a>
         just visit our information page we linked to.
        </p>
        <h3>
         <span style="color: #000000;">
          Hardware Design
         </span>
        </h3>
        <p>
         The PS4 has quite a stylish design, ditching the square look of most consoles with a unique angular shape on two ends. Its widest areas measure in at 10.8 inches x 12 inches x 2 inches, making it pretty cabinet-friendly and unlikely to take up more room than either the Xbox 360 or PlayStation 3.
        </p>
        <p>
         The half gloss, half matte finish only serves to make the PS4 look even more attractive on your desk or home theater system. Sonys system also weighs in at a respectable 6 pounds. (2.75kg), meaning it weighs almost half as much as its predecessor, the PS3.
        </p>
        <h3>
         <span style="color: #000000;">
          The DualShock 4 controller
         </span>
        </h3>
        <a class="easyazon-link" data-cart="n" data-cloak="y" data-identifier="B00BGA9X9W" data-locale="US" data-localize="y" data-popups="y" data-tag="whaispla400-20" href="http://whatisplaystation4.com/product/B00BGA9X9W/US/whaispla400-20/" rel="nofollow" target="_blank">
         <img class="easyazon-image alignleft" height="160" src="http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/41ih-c4lfVL._SL160_.jpg" width="160"/>
        </a>
        <p>
         The
         <a class="easyazon-link" data-cart="n" data-cloak="y" data-identifier="B00BGA9X9W" data-locale="US" data-localize="y" data-popups="y" data-tag="whaispla400-20" href="http://whatisplaystation4.com/product/B00BGA9X9W/US/whaispla400-20/" rel="nofollow" target="_blank">
          DualShock 4 is one of the more impressive game controllers
         </a>
         ever built. The shape and design make it rest comfortably in any pair of hands, allowing for easy access to buttons and triggers.
        </p>
        <p>
         It also boasts a touch pad and Share button, two feature that increase the convenience and uniqueness of the PS4s controller.
        </p>
        <h3>
         <span style="color: #000000;">
          Entertainment Features
         </span>
        </h3>
        <p>
         Amazon Instant Video, MLB.TV Premium, and the WWE Network are a few of the countless apps you can enjoy on your PS4. Your console will also pay attention to your preferences and add pre-loaded content that you may be interested in.
        </p>
        <p>
         If you have a PS Vita,
         <a href="http://whatisplaystation4.com/playstation-4-specs-and-capabilities/ps4-remote-play/">
          Remote Play allows you to use it as a companion device
         </a>
         for several PS4 titles. This means that you can play a game entirely on your handheld device without having to use the television, which is great for those who like moving around without having to end their game.
        </p>
        <p>
         Similarly, the PlayStation App lets you use your iPhone, iPad, and Android smartphones and tablet devices with your PS4 games. After installing the app, players can check out certain game elements, buy and download PS4 games, and even watch the gameplay of other players on their device.
        </p>
        <h3>
         <span style="color: #000000;">
          Motion Gaming
         </span>
        </h3>
        <a class="easyazon-link" data-cart="n" data-cloak="y" data-identifier="B00BGAA3S2" data-locale="US" data-localize="y" data-popups="y" data-tag="whaispla400-20" href="http://whatisplaystation4.com/product/B00BGAA3S2/US/whaispla400-20/" rel="nofollow" target="_blank">
         <img class="easyazon-image alignleft" height="160" src="http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/31vC6fcF70L._SL160_.jpg" width="160"/>
        </a>
        <p>
         The successor to the PlayStation Eye
         <a class="easyazon-link" data-cart="n" data-cloak="y" data-identifier="B00BGAA3S2" data-locale="US" data-localize="y" data-popups="y" data-tag="whaispla400-20" href="http://whatisplaystation4.com/product/B00BGAA3S2/US/whaispla400-20/" rel="nofollow" target="_blank">
          is the PlayStation Camera
         </a>
         , a motion sensing accessory for the PS4 that features dual cameras. With two cameras it is better at depth-sensing objects in its field of vision and each one can perform a different function, such as one tracking motion while the other generates the video image.
        </p>
        <p>
         Although
         <a href="http://whatisplaystation4.com/5-reasons-to-buy-a-playstation-camera/">
          the PlayStation Cameras more impressive features
         </a>
         involve livestreams and sharing walkthroughs, it also offers interesting motion gaming experiences by working with the Dualshock 4 and PlayStation Move accessories. The PlayStation Camera allows both of these controller types to track player movements better than ever, making games like Just Dance 2014 even more responsive.
        </p>
        <h3>
         <span style="color: #000000;">
          Online Service
         </span>
        </h3>
        <a class="easyazon-link" data-cart="n" data-cloak="y" data-identifier="B004RMK5QG" data-locale="US" data-localize="y" data-popups="y" data-tag="whaispla400-20" href="http://whatisplaystation4.com/product/B004RMK5QG/US/whaispla400-20/" rel="nofollow" target="_blank">
         <img class="easyazon-image alignleft" height="160" src="http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/51Vqh2-CeCL._SL160_.jpg" width="114"/>
        </a>
        <p>
         Unlike the PS3,
         <a class="easyazon-link" data-cart="n" data-cloak="y" data-identifier="B004RMK5QG" data-locale="US" data-localize="y" data-popups="y" data-tag="whaispla400-20" href="http://whatisplaystation4.com/product/B004RMK5QG/US/whaispla400-20/" rel="nofollow" target="_blank">
          PlayStation Plus is required to play games online
         </a>
         on your PS4. This sounds terrible for those who believe they should be able to play their $60 titles online without a subscription fee, but PlayStation Plus offers too many benefits to complain about.
        </p>
        <p>
         For starters, the Instant Game Collection lets you download a select number of games entirely for free if you dont count the PS Plus fee of course. The best part is that these games are usually pretty good ones and not shovel ware youd find at your local shopping stores discount shelf.
        </p>
        <p>
         Instead, the PS Plus service lets you play games like Outlast, Resogun, Injustice: Gods Among Us  Ultimate Edition, and Trine 2: Complete Story. The number of available games isnt as impressive as the PS3s Instant Game library but thats because the PS4 is only a year old. But theres still something to look forward to each month with PS Plus.
        </p>
        <p>
         The following is a list of all the benefits PlayStation Plus offers to PS4 owners:
        </p>
        <p>
         (source:
         <a href="http://www.playstation.com/en-us/explore/playstation-plus/" target="_blank">
          http://www.playstation.com/en-us/explore/playstation-plus/
         </a>
         )
        </p>
        <ul>
         <li>
          Online Multiplayer
         </li>
         <li>
          Instant Game Collection
         </li>
         <li>
          Exclusive Discounts
         </li>
         <li>
          Online Game Saves
         </li>
         <li>
          Exclusive Betas
         </li>
         <li>
          Full Game Trials (coming soon)
         </li>
        </ul>
        <hr/>
        <p>
        </p>
        <h2>
         Benefits and features of the Xbox One
        </h2>
        <h3>
         <span style="color: #000000;">
          Graphics/Specs
         </span>
        </h3>
        <a class="easyazon-link" data-cart="n" data-cloak="y" data-identifier="B00KAI3KW2" data-locale="US" data-localize="y" data-popups="y" data-tag="whaispla400-20" href="http://whatisplaystation4.com/product/B00KAI3KW2/US/whaispla400-20/" rel="nofollow" target="_blank">
         <img class="easyazon-image alignnone" height="500" src="http://whatisplaystation4.com/wp-content/uploads/2015/03/41ZaZOH3L.jpg" width="500"/>
        </a>
        <p>
         Microsofts new console has plenty of muscle with its 8 Core AMD custom CPU, allowing Xbox One developers to deliver high-quality graphics and detailed worlds like never before. Just like the PS4, this also lets Xbox One users conveniently switch between games, movies, and apps without having to completely close any of them.
        </p>
        <p>
         Thanks to the 8GB of DDR3 RAM and 64-bit processors, the Xbox One can load heavy amounts of info smoothly enough to provide a visual spectacle. This means that cities can have more people, towering bosses will look even more amazing, and all the players on FIFA and other sports games can finally look more like their real life personas.
        </p>
        <p>
         When it comes to the GPU, Xbox One contains a semi-custom AMD APU similar to the Bonaire core from the Radeon HD 7790. Comparable to an entry-level PC graphics processor, this means that Microsofts console can maintain decent frame rates even when theres plenty going on in the game.
        </p>
        <p>
         Fortunately Microsoft recently allowed developers to use about 8% of the horsepower previously dedicated to Kinect, giving developers a better chance of making their games avoid frame rate issues.
        </p>
        <p>
         Additionally, an August 2014 patch introduced 3D Blu-ray support to the Xbox One, which means you can now enjoy 3D movies if your TV is 3D-capable.
        </p>
        <h3>
         <span style="color: #000000;">
          Hardware Design
         </span>
        </h3>
        <p>
         Just like every Xbox system before it, the Xbox Ones size dwarves most other game consoles and Blu-ray/DVD players sitting next to it.
        </p>
        <p>
         It features a square design that measures in at 13.4 inches x 10.4 inches x 3.2 inches, which means youll need plenty of space for it in your entertainment center. It also weighs nearly 8 lbs (3.56 kg), making it just as heavy as the original Xbox console.
        </p>
        <h3>
         <span style="color: #000000;">
          The Xbox One controller
         </span>
        </h3>
        <p>
         The successor to one of the most popular gaming controls of all time,
         <a class="easyazon-link" data-cart="n" data-cloak="y" data-identifier="B00CMQTUSS" data-locale="US" data-localize="y" data-popups="y" data-tag="whaispla400-20" href="http://whatisplaystation4.com/product/B00CMQTUSS/US/whaispla400-20/" rel="nofollow" target="_blank">
          the Xbox One controller succeeds
         </a>
         in making much-needed improvements without taking anything away from what made the 360 controller awesome.
        </p>
        <p>
         Best of all, the D-pad is a significant improvement from the one on the Xbox 360, allowing for sweeping D-pad movement that fighting game enthusiasts can enjoy.
        </p>
        <h3>
         <span style="color: #000000;">
          Entertainment Features
         </span>
        </h3>
        <p>
         Remember all the criticism toward Microsoft for focusing too much on entertainment features during the consoles reveal? Well, people are starting to realize just how awesome it is that their Xbox One enhances almost all of their entertainment experiences.
        </p>
        <p>
         For starters, the Xbox One has a Blu-ray/DVD optical drive, making it the first Xbox system that can play Blu-ray discs as well as DVDs. Like the Xbox 360, there are also plenty of apps to check out such as Netflix, Hulu Plus, Amazon Instant Video, and so much more. From Xbox Music and Skype voice calls to live sports and Upload Studio, the Xbox One allows users to conveniently switch between apps and games at any time.
        </p>
        <p>
         Best of all, each profile can have their own custom Home screen that offers instant access to all your preferred apps and entertainment. The user interface is one of the best weve ever seen for a gaming console and serves to make the Xbox One much smoother and more convenient to use.
        </p>
        <p>
         Xbox Smart Glass also lets you use your mobile phone or tablet as a second screen to interact with your Xbox One, much like the PlayStation App. This works with nearly every entertainment feature, including TV shows, movies, music, sports programs, and games.
        </p>
        <h3>
         <span style="color: #000000;">
          Motion Gaming
         </span>
        </h3>
        <a class="easyazon-link" data-cart="n" data-cloak="y" data-identifier="B00JSE09UK" data-locale="US" data-localize="y" data-popups="y" data-tag="whaispla400-20" href="http://whatisplaystation4.com/product/B00JSE09UK/US/whaispla400-20/" rel="nofollow" target="_blank">
         <img class="easyazon-image alignleft" height="90" src="http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/215HLOePsCL._SL160_.jpg" width="160"/>
        </a>
        <p>
         The new
         <a class="easyazon-link" data-cart="n" data-cloak="y" data-identifier="B00JSE09UK" data-locale="US" data-localize="y" data-popups="y" data-tag="whaispla400-20" href="http://whatisplaystation4.com/product/B00JSE09UK/US/whaispla400-20/" rel="nofollow" target="_blank">
          Kinect for Xbox One comes with significant improvements
         </a>
         , allowing for motion and voice control out of the box. While the original Kinect had a VGA sensor, the new Kinects 1080p camera is much more effective at reading environments as it processes 2 gigs of data per second. The lag that often plagued the original Kinect is also nearly non-existent as the new Kinect offers an amazing 1:1 movement ratio.
        </p>
        <p>
         Just like the PlayStation Camera and Move, Kinect is still an option unless the game requires it. Only a few games currently available need Kinect to be fully enjoyed, such as Kinect Sports Rivals and Fruit Ninja Kinect 2.
        </p>
        <p>
         However, many games like Killer Instinct and Project Spark allow the Kinect to do neat things that enhance the experience but are not required to fully play the game.
        </p>
        <h3>
         <span style="color: #000000;">
          Online Service
         </span>
        </h3>
        <a class="easyazon-link" data-cart="n" data-cloak="y" data-identifier="B002VBWIP6" data-locale="US" data-localize="y" data-popups="y" data-tag="whaispla400-20" href="http://whatisplaystation4.com/product/B002VBWIP6/US/whaispla400-20/" rel="nofollow" target="_blank">
         <img class="easyazon-image alignleft" height="160" src="http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/51SgpAmAlAL._SL160_.jpg" width="116"/>
        </a>
        <p>
         Just like the Xbox 360,
         <a class="easyazon-link" data-cart="n" data-cloak="y" data-identifier="B002VBWIP6" data-locale="US" data-localize="y" data-popups="y" data-tag="whaispla400-20" href="http://whatisplaystation4.com/product/B002VBWIP6/US/whaispla400-20/" rel="nofollow" target="_blank">
          Xbox Live Gold is required to play online
         </a>
         on your Xbox One. Fortunately Microsoft realized how impressive Sonys PlayStation Plus service was getting and decided to sweeten their own deal with Games for Gold.
        </p>
        <p>
         Games for Gold is slightly different from Sonys Instant Game Collection in that only one new game is available for download every month two games a month for Xbox 360. Whereas Sony requires you to stay a PS+ member to play the free games, Microsoft lets you keep the title for good once you download it.
        </p>
        <p>
         Although Games for Gold support only started in June of 2014, some great games have already been made available. This includes titles like Halo: Spartan Assault, Crimson Dragon, Guacamelee! Super Turbo Championship Edition, and Max: The Curse of Brotherhood.
        </p>
        <p>
         Games for Gold usually offers good titles to play but the number of available games is much smaller than what the PlayStation Plus Instant Games Collection offers.
        </p>
        <p>
         Aside from free game and online multiplayer, having Xbox Live Gold also lets you receive huge discounts on select games and other benefits.

        </p>
        <h2>
         PS4 vs Xbox One Comparison
        </h2>
        <p>
         Now that youve checked out a brief rundown of the benefits and features for PS4 and Xbox One, lets compare them to see how each console fairs next to the other.
        </p>
        <p>
         Aside from owning each console, there is no better way to see if the PS4 or Xbox One is the perfect console for you. And if
         <a href="http://whatisplaystation4.com/what-is-the-best-console-for-kids/">
          youre trying to buy a console for your kids
         </a>
         , then choosing between the Xbox One and PS4 can be even more frustrating.
        </p>
        <p>
         Rest assured, our website has done the research and we own all the consoles. Whether youre all about exclusives, want the most powerful system, are looking at motion control support as a deciding factor, or you want to get the most bang for your buck, the following should be of use.
        </p>
        <h3>
         <span style="color: #000000;">
          Games on PS4 and Xbox One
         </span>
        </h3>
        <p>
         <a href="http://www.amazon.com/s/?_encoding=UTF8&amp;camp=1789&amp;creative=390957&amp;field-keywords=&amp;linkCode=ur2&amp;tag=whaispla400-20&amp;url=search-alias%3Dvideogames&amp;linkId=IPQYNMFRH53LZX3A">
          <img alt="Dragon Age Inquisition for PS4 and Xbox One" class="alignnone wp-image-4249" height="422" src="http://whatisplaystation4.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/Dragon-Age-Inquisition-troll-fight-1024x576.jpg" width="750"/>
         </a>
        </p>
        <p>
         When it comes to choosing on whether to buy a PS4 or Xbox One, most go by what games each one offers. The truth is, both consoles will share most of the same games since both companies have strong relationships with the same third party developers.
        </p>
        <p>
         Games like Assassins Creed, Call of Duty, FIFA youll see them all on both the Xbox One and PlayStation 4 for years to come.
        </p>
        <p>
         What matters then are the exclusives. In other words, what games will you only be able to play on the Xbox One and PS4? Although neither can hold a candle to Nintendo when were talking 1st party, both have quite a few games that may be enough to convince you.
        </p>
        <p>
         If youve always been more of a shooter fan, the Xbox One may be the choice for you. Both Halo 5 and the next Gears of War will be releasing on the Xbox One in the near future.
        </p>
        <p>
         With franchises like Halo and Gears of War, youll get some of the best first and third-person shooter experiences video games have to offer.
        </p>
        <p>
         For the driving simulation fan, the highly rated Forza series is Microsofts answer to Sonys Gran Turismo games. The Forza franchise on Xbox One has not just Forza 5 but Forza Horizon 2 available to play as well. Unfortunately, the PS4 only has DriveClub which has received very negative reviews and a poor reception by gamers. The PlayStation 4 will have a bit of a wait before we see a new Gran Turismo.
        </p>
        <p>
         Although things have changed since the original Xbox, the Fable series still continues to give RPG fans something to look forward to on their Xbox One. With the Fable Legends beta and then game releasing soon, the Xbox One will have a familiar RPG exclusive for gamers to own on the Xbox One.
        </p>
        <p>
         Still though, the PS4 will have something new and impressive in Bloodborne. Fans of the Souls series (Demon Souls/Dark Souls) have rallied behind this PS4 exclusive for a few reasons:
        </p>
        <ol>
         <li>
          It looks incredible graphically.
         </li>
         <li>
          Its made by From Software (Well respected developer studio).
         </li>
         <li>
          Its a new take on a beloved franchise.
         </li>
         <li>
          The game has a very interesting and unique setting.
         </li>
         <li>
          Its something different and mysterious.
         </li>
        </ol>
        <p>
         PlayStation 4s exclusives provide a bit more variety with action-platformer games like Knack, first-person shooters like Killzone: Shadow Fall, and open-world adventure games like Infamous: Second Son to name a few.
        </p>
        <p>
         Similarly, the list of exclusives planned for future release also contain different genres, offering something for players of all tastes. And its nice to know that both video game consoles support
         <a href="http://whatisplaystation4.com/best-video-games-for-kids-a-parents-guide/">
          all types of games for kids and families
         </a>
         .
        </p>
        <p>
         The following is a list of five currently available exclusives followed by five games set to release soon, all exclusives:
        </p>

         </li>

        <h3>
         <span style="color: #000000;">
          Graphics/Specs
         </span>
        </h3>
        <p>
         <a href="http://whatisplaystation4.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/PS4-vs-Xbox-One-specs-e1426891591313.jpg">
          <img alt="" class="alignnone wp-image-4252 size-full" height="646" src="http://whatisplaystation4.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/PS4-vs-Xbox-One-specs-e1426891591313.jpg" width="984"/>
         </a>
        </p>
        <p>
         If theres one thing almost all gamers look forward to when your consoles hit store shelves, its the thought of playing games on a much more powerful system. Better graphics and processing capability means that game worlds can be larger, look better than ever, and have more details.
        </p>
        <p>
         Both Microsoft and Sony have always sought to make sure their home consoles have impressive specs that will remain relevant for five to ten years. The question is: which one offers the best graphics Xbox One or PS4?
        </p>
        <p>
         The best way to find out is to simply run the same game side-by-side and compare the results from each console. Fortunately you dont have to do this yourself as
         <a href="http://www.eurogamer.net/?topic=digital_foundry" target="_blank">
          youll find plenty of comparison videos and images
         </a>
         like this throughout the internet.
        </p>
        <p>
         The conclusion is that although both specs arent worlds apart, one console does tend to have slightly better visuals.
        </p>
        <p>
         When comparing both consoles by playing a cross-platform game like Metal Gear Solid V: Ground Zeroes, the PS4 version was slightly clearer and showed textures objects at farther distances. This makes sense because the PS4 can achieve 1080p at 30 or 60 frames per second while the Xbox One runs at 720p or 900p at 30 or 60fps.
        </p>
        <p>
         Although 1080p and 60fps always gets thrown around in a PS4 vs Xbox One debate, its actually pretty hard to notice the differences. Even by actually watching a side-by-side comparison of a PS4 game at 1080p and an Xbox One game running at 900p, many people fail to tell the difference. And there are cases where a game like Ryse running at 900p still looks incredible no matter how you slice it.
        </p>
        <p>
         Theres also the fact that now more than ever, 3
         <sup>
          rd
         </sup>
         party games on Xbox One are hitting the same 1080p/30fps bar that the PS4 has been. Thanks to the added resources freed up from not using the Kinect, developers are able to get a bit more power from the Xbox One. This is evident from the recent jump from 900p to 1080p for Destiny on Xbox One.
        </p>
        <p>
         Still at this point in time, the consensus is that the PS4 is the more powerful system and games will run and look better on the PlayStation 4. To be honest though, the visual differences in games are in most cases, hardly noticeable. But in a few games, it is quite noticeable.
        </p>
        <p>
         So if graphics and power are your deciding factor, you may slightly consider the PS4 over the Xbox One, but with an emphasis on slightly. The visuals on both games look amazing and as developers get more comfortable with these new systems, games are only going to look better and better.
        </p>
        <p>
         If you really want the best graphics money can pay for, you should probably be looking into PC instead. Otherwise, youll be good in the graphics that will blow me away department with either a PS4 or Xbox One.
        </p>
        <h3>
         <span style="color: #000000;">
          Hardware Design
         </span>
        </h3>
        <p>
         <a href="http://www.amazon.com/best-sellers-video-games/zgbs/videogames/?_encoding=UTF8&amp;camp=1789&amp;creative=390957&amp;linkCode=ur2&amp;tag=whaispla400-20&amp;linkId=KPX22FCUKFK6TYWN">
          <img alt="PlayStation 4 versus Xbox One design" class="alignnone wp-image-4253" height="422" src="http://whatisplaystation4.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/PS4-vs-Xbox-One-design.jpg" width="750"/>
         </a>
        </p>
        <p>
         Youd be surprised by how many people take into consideration the size and shape of a new device theyre planning on buying.
        </p>
        <p>
         Between the television, cable/satellite TV box, DVD and Blu-ray players, surround sound systems, other gaming systems, and even that old VHS player for watching home movies, your entertainment center is crowded enough as it is.
        </p>
        <p>
         Although its not the most important deciding factor in our opinion, it is important for many people that their new console looks good in their home entertainment setup.
        </p>
        <p>
         Of the two, the PS4 is certainly the more cabinet-friendly console as it is smaller and weighs less. Not only that, the half matte, half gloss finish and angular shape make it much more attractive and easy to show off to guests, if youre that kind of person.
        </p>
        <p>
         The ports are a little tougher to get to and theres no side USB port, but the PS4 is easy to place anywhere and can be stood up vertically without worrying about it crushing something when it falls.
        </p>
        <p>
         The Xbox One, however, isnt meant to be stood horizontally and should always be laid flat to avoid damage to the disc drive. Considering how heavy it is, this is probably safer anyways as some kind of earthquake or accident could result in your near-10lb beast doing some damage to your cabinet, other devices, etc.
        </p>
        <p>
         It goes without saying that the Xbox One is a lot bulkier and harder to find room for if your entertainment setup is already crowded.
        </p>
        <p>
         In terms of looks, the Xbox One also isnt entirely impressive and wed argue that the Xbox 360 Slim had more style. The problem is that the Xbox One is large and square, making it look like a VCR from the 1990s.
        </p>
        <p>
         Even if a consoles look is at the bottom of your list of things to care about when choosing a console, its still nice to know the thing youre spending a few hundred bucks on isnt going to look like an old piece of technology.
        </p>
        <p>
         Hopefully your primary criteria for buying a game console isnt its size or looks since there are better things to consider. But if youre the kind of person that wants to make sure the console that will be sitting in your entertainment setup for the next 5 to 10 years looks good, you may want to go with a PlayStation 4.
        </p>
        <h3>
         <span style="color: #000000;">
          How easy is it to move each console?
         </span>
        </h3>
        <p>
         If youre the type of person who has to move their console a lot. The PS4 is hands down the winner here. For instance, if you move your console from room to room or take it with you on trips, the PS4 is far easier to move around compared to the Xbox One.
        </p>
        <p>
         Why? Well the PS4 has no power brick. Just a controller, the console, power cable, and HDMI cord. Not to mention that the PS4 is really light and easy to carry around.
        </p>
        <p>
         The Xbox One on the other hand is heavy and bulky. It also comes with a power brick and if you have a Kinect, well, then theres that too. So youll have to move a heavier console, power brick, Kinect, HDMI cable, controller, and all the cables for the Kinect and power brick.
        </p>
        <p>
         Just something to think about.
        </p>
        <h3>
         <span style="color: #000000;">
          Entertainment Features
         </span>
        </h3>
        <p>
         <a href="http://www.amazon.com/s/?_encoding=UTF8&amp;camp=1789&amp;creative=390957&amp;field-keywords=&amp;linkCode=ur2&amp;tag=whaispla400-20&amp;url=search-alias%3Dmovies-tv&amp;linkId=2HLVZJJ6IHLQ2YWK">
          <img alt="PlayStation App versus Smartglass" class="alignnone wp-image-4256" height="422" src="http://whatisplaystation4.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/PlayStation-App-versus-Smartglass.jpg" width="750"/>
         </a>
        </p>
        <ul>
         <li>
          Do both consoles play both DVD and Blu-ray discs?
          <strong>
           Check
          </strong>
          .
         </li>
         <li>
          Do both consoles offer a wide variety of apps such as Netflix, Hulu Plus, and Amazon Instant Video?
          <strong>
           Check
          </strong>
          .
         </li>
         <li>
          Do both consoles let you hop in and out of apps, games, and movies with ease?
          <strong>
           Check
          </strong>
          .
         </li>
         <li>
          Do both consoles let you use smartphones and tablets to interact?
          <strong>
           Check
          </strong>
          .
         </li>
        </ul>
        <p>
         When it comes to entertainment features, the PS4 and Xbox One are pretty matched up. However, if theres one thing the Xbox 360 always had better over the PlayStation 3, its an intuitive UI.
        </p>
        <p>
         With these new consoles the same is true as the Xbox One boasts customizable Home screens that lets every profile view their favorite apps and games with ease. The PS4 has the same feature but the Xbox Ones customization options and user interface is definitely top notch so far this generation.
        </p>
        <p>
         The PS4 is great too and definitely an improvement over the PS3s UI, but its the Xbox One that people with both consoles are saying is easier to move around in. So if youre getting a PS4 or Xbox One for all the entertainment features, youre ok with either. But if you absolutely must have the one with the better user interface, you may consider the Xbox One as your choice.
        </p>
        <p>
         As far as entertainment, seamless software, and updates, the Xbox One fairs better.
        </p>
        <p>
         First of all, you can integrate your Xbox One into your cable/satellite TV system with the Xbox One Guide. For football fans, Xbox One has a strong partnership with the NFL and provides a Fantasy Football League built in. The Xbox One has snap functionality, constant dashboard (User Interface) updates, Xbox Video, Xbox Music, One Drive, Skype, and of course the popular Xbox Live service.
        </p>
        <p>
         Now, if youre somebody who has Windows 8, then the Xbox One is a perfect candidate to add to your Windows ecosystem. For example, you can watch your Xbox Videos (Movies/TV shows) across Xbox One, Xbox 360, PC, Laptop, smartphones, and tablets.
        </p>
        <p>
         But lets not forget, Sony has some things up their sleeve as well. With PlayStation 4, you get not just Remote Play, PS Vita TV, and the incredible service that is PS Plus. Theres also exciting technology like Sonys VR Headset called Project Morpheus and the video games streaming service PlayStation Now.
        </p>
        <p>
         What is PlayStation Now? Well its a streaming service (like Netflix) that lets you rent games, and play them through your PS4. So basically to solve the problem with PS4 coming with no backwards compatibility, PS Now was invented.
        </p>
        <p>
         With PlayStation Now you can stream PS3 games like Metal Gear Solid 4, Rachet and Clank: Into the Nexus, and other PS3 games on your PS4.
        </p>
        <p>
         VR and a video game streaming service is something that the Xbox One does not have and theres no guarantee that they will ever have it. So this is something you should definitely take into consideration when buying a PS4 versus and Xbox One.
        </p>
        <h3>
         <span style="color: #000000;">
          Motion Gaming
         </span>
        </h3>
        <p>
         Its no secret that Microsoft did more to go after the motion gaming market by even having the Xbox One originally come with the Kinect, whether you wanted it or not. In fact, Sony was willing to ditch the PlayStation Camera entirely from the PS4s main bundle just to undercut the Xbox One in terms of price.
        </p>
        <p>
         Even if the Xbox One hopes to cater more to motion gaming enthusiasts with Kinect, there are still not too many motion control games for either console. Both have the Just Dance games, but the Xbox One boasts more with Kinect Sports Rivals, D4: Dark Dreams Dont Die, Fighter Within, and Fruit Ninja Kinect 2 to name a few. Several games also have little features that integrate Kinect, such as Killer Instinct and Zoo Tycoon.
        </p>
        <p>
         Although neither accessory is significantly better than the other, both doing just as they promise, Kinect looks like it will receive the most support in the long run. Thus, if you or your family still cant get enough of the motion gaming craze that Nintendos Wii made popular, your best bet is the Xbox One.
        </p>
        <p>
         The other thing to think about is video game broadcasting. Streaming live gameplay was made popular by Twitch. And both the PS4 and Xbox One have Twitch available. This means you can take your Kinect or PlayStation Camera and broadcast your gameplay for others to see.
        </p>
        <h3>
         <span style="color: #000000;">
          Online Service
         </span>
        </h3>
        <p>
         <a href="http://whatisplaystation4.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/PlayStation-Plus-versus-Games-with-Gold.jpg">
          <img alt="PlayStation Plus versus Games with Gold" class="alignnone size-full wp-image-4254" height="385" src="http://whatisplaystation4.com/wp-content/uploads/2014/11/PlayStation-Plus-versus-Games-with-Gold.jpg" width="665"/>
         </a>
        </p>
        <p>
         Together the PS3 and Xbox 360 revolutionized gaming by offering impressive amounts of features with their online capabilities.
        </p>
        <p>
         Of the two, it was the Xbox 360 that got away with charging for their Gold service to play games online, use streaming apps, and more. And although the days when Sony gamers could brag about being able to play online for free are gone, the massive perks offered by PlayStation Plus make it ok.
        </p>
        <p>
         If theres one way that PlayStation Plus has been blowing Xbox Live out of the water for a few years now, its the Instant Game Collection. How does being able to download a few games for free sound? The only catch is that you can only play them if you remain a PS+ subscriber, which is ok because these games are almost always must-play titles.
        </p>
        <p>
         Injustice: Gods Among Us  Ultimate Edition, Resogun, and Dead Nation are a few of the many acclaimed games that have been available for download on the PS4. PS Plus is even better if you also own a PS3 or PS Vita as Instant Game Collection offers free games on those platforms as well. This means your one PS Plus subscription works across PS4, PS3, and the PS Vita.
        </p>
        <p>
         Xbox Live Gold, on the other hand, also launched their Games with Gold program that lets you download two games for free each month. The games are usually good, with Dark Souls being one of the 2013 titles, but the number of available games is much smaller than what the Instant Game Collection offers.
        </p>
        <p>
         You also get beta access, 1-hour free access to full games, cloud storage, game discounts, and more. Even when it comes to other benefits, PS+ is better. Both services offer free games, exclusive discounts, and online multiplayer, but PS+ also offers early access to demos, cloud storage, 1-hour free access to full games, and a few small perks that together start making an impression.
        </p>
        <p>
         When it comes to a PS4 vs. Xbox One debate in terms of their online services, Sonys PlayStation Plus makes the PS4 an excellent choice. Still, Xbox has Games withGold, and the consensus is that Xbox Live remains a superior network to the PSN. Plus theres the new addition of EA Access which is an Xbox exclusive service. So at the end of the day, you just have to know exactly what you want from either online service. And then make a decision from there.
        </p>
        <hr/>
        <p>
        </p>
        <h2>
         Are you going to buy a PS4 or Xbox One?
        </h2>
        <p>
         Its always exciting to buy a brand new video game console, especially when its new and promises to deliver bigger and better games than you thought possible. It can also be quite frustrating deciding which one to buy since, after all, you are spending your hard-earned cash to pick one up.
        </p>
        <p>
         If you were to straight ask us to pretty please (with a cherry on top) tell you how we would make the decision, itd be based on the games. No matter how expensive they are, both the PS4 and Xbox One are useless unless youre playing games. Yes they play apps and streaming services, but so does your computer, smartphones, Smart TVs and tablets.
        </p>
        <p>
         If you start by looking at which console has or will have the kind of games youre more interested in, thats probably the best way to go. After that, consider all the neat features and subscription service benefits to finally convince yourself which gaming console will give you the most hours of joy.
        </p>
